data.title: Oracle Negotiating to Buy Israel's Zend
data.meta_description: And Several Other Companies, to Gain Control Over Open Code
data.text:
Software giant Oracle is in negotiations to buy three open-code companies, one of which is Israel's Zend Technologies, sources told BusinessWeek. Zend - "the PHP company " ? makes web application platform products and services for PHP applications. PHP is a server-side HTML embedded scripting language.

Israeli-born Woman Replaces Ellison at Oracle

Just this Thursday Oracle, chaired by billionaire Larry Ellison, announced 2,000 layoffs, to shed redundancies after its merger with Siebel Systems.

Oracle is also negotiating to buy mediation software company JBoss and Sleepycat Software for a total of about $600 million. Sleepycat makes the Berkeley DB family of open source developer databases.

The various acquisition talks reinforce the notion that Oracle wants a foot into open code, which until now has been considered the enemy. Speaking at a conference last week, Ellison commented that instead of fighting the trend, Oracle has decided to harness it to its needs.

The sources told BusinessWeek that the talks could be just the opening shot: Larry Ellison and Safra Catz, the company's president and chief financial officer, have a clear strategy to take control of the open code sphere.

Last year Oracle bought another open code company, Innobase of Finland.
